glosses: to lick (to stroke with a tongue), to lick something up

examples.text: Küçük kızımı yerdeki kırık kavanozdan reçel yalarken gördüm.
examples.translation: I saw my little daughter while she was licking jam from the broken jar on the floor.

glosses: to graze or skim over, pass just above or near the surface of

etymology: From Ottoman Turkish یالامق (yalamak, “to lick, lick up”), from Proto-Turkic *yālga- (“to lick”). Cognate with Azerbaijani yalamaq and Turkmen ýalamak.
